import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

df = pd.read_csv('../input/titanic-data/titanic.csv')
df
source.96b4306e:
age_0 = df[df['Survived']==0]['Age']
age_1 = df[df['Survived']==1]['Age']
fare_0 = df[df['Survived']==0]['Fare']
fare_1 = df[df['Survived']==1]['Fare']
source.06e6aaf2:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
fig=plt.figure()
plt.scatter(age_0, fare_0, label='Not Survived')
plt.scatter(age_1, fare_1, label = 'Survived')
plt.legend()
plt.xlabel('Age')
plt.ylabel('Fare')
plt.title('Survived V/S not survived')
plt.show()

source.289f000c: Problem : In this notebook, I will build a model that classify whether person survived or not survived in the Titanic accident. I will be implement classification using linear and non-linear support vector machine. I will use Titanic dataset for this problem. As this data is not linearly seperable, so we can see a large difference bitween the linear SVM and non-linear SVM model. If data is not linearly seperable, then we have to use Non-linear SVM.
source.1082e9a4: Here we can see that the score has increased and it reached to 92.14% of accuracy, which is much better.
